messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] flooring
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/26/2004 1:32:17 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Cut some brown paper bags open flat. Glue them to the floor. Spread polyurethane over top.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/26/2004 1:32:17 AM Eastern Standard Time,
tumile@... writes:
>>Here's a cheap flooring idea I read about.
Cut some brown paper bags open flat. Glue them to the floor. Spread
polyurethane over top. Might need two coats. Supposedly looks really cool. I'd try it
on scrap wood first to see if I like it.
Diane<<
My head is spinning with all these cool floor ideas! We built our house and
recently added on, then ran out of money before the floor got finished. Hubby
and I have really been re-evaluating "things" and needs for nice stuff (we
ran out of money before we got cupboards and more counters in the kitchen too)
and have decided we'd rather make due with what we have and not stress. I
have tons of scrap material, so I think we'll take the scrap wood and build
shelves and hang curtains over them instead of cupboards. Any ideas for counters?

Nancy B.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] flooring
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/26/2004 1:32:01 AM Eastern Daylight Time, tumile@comcast.net writes: Here s a cheap flooring idea I read about. Cut some brown paper bags
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/26/2004 1:32:01 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
tumile@... writes:
Here's a cheap flooring idea I read about.
Cut some brown paper bags open flat. Glue them to the floor. Spread
polyurethane over top. Might need two coats. Supposedly looks really cool. I'd try it
on scrap wood first to see if I like it.<<<<

I did that with my walls in two of my bathrooms. I crumpled the bags up
first, then pasted them on with wallpaper paste. Then painted; no polyurethane.
It's an interesting look!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: flooring
messages.msgSnippet: Here s a cheap flooring idea I read about. Cut some brown paper bags open flat. Glue them to the floor. Spread polyurethane over top. Might need two coats.
messages.messageBody:
Here's a cheap flooring idea I read about.
Cut some brown paper bags open flat. Glue them to the floor. Spread polyurethane over top. Might need two coats. Supposedly looks really cool. I'd try it on scrap wood first to see if I like it.
Diane

--
"Just as eating against one's will is injurious to health, so
study without a liking for it spoils the memory, and it retains
nothing it takes in." -Leonardo da Vinci
